chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Beatriz Sangabriel Alarcon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beatriz Sangabriel Alarcon

Defendant Beatriz Sangabriel Alarcon in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended information filed in each case.  Plea to single count as amended.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$516.00 fine/costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.  With DNA surcharge.
